pageContext.claim: “In a letter to me sent by Kim Jong Un, he stated, very nicely, that he would like to meet and start negotiations as soon as the joint U.S./South Korea joint exercise are over. It was a long letter, much of it complaining about the ridiculous and expensive exercises.”
pageContext.analysis: Trump canceled military exercises in the Korean peninsula and said they cost "hundreds of millions of dollars." But the cost is far lower. CBS calculated the cost at $3.5 million for the exercises Trump canceled. Reuters pegged the cost at $14 million, citing U.S. officials.
